result.execSummary:
The defendant Sarah J Ruppelt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Sarah J Ruppelt is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Sarah J Ruppelt was found guilty of Possess Amphetamine/LSD/Psilocin, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Paidin full to Clerk of Court office.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sarah J Ruppelt

Defendant, Sarah J Ruppelt appeared with Attorney James C McLaughlin.  Attorney Thomas H Frost appeared for the State. Plea hearing.  Atty McL. addresses court. Court questions Ms. Ruppelt. Court finds Mr. Ruppelt understands and waives.  Factual basis, Pleads Guilty. On her plea court finds her guilty.  Atty Frost will file amend. to count 1. Factual basis for amended charge. Court accepts plea and finds guilty. Count 2 dismissed.
Atty Frost recommends w/h sent 1 yr probation with AODA
Atty McL addresses court. 
Ms. Ruppelt adddresses court. Court w/h sent. and puts on prob. for 1 yr with DOC. Stat. costs with 60 days to pay.

Sarah's aunt called and stated that Sarah does not live at the address we have on file. She uses it to get her mail. They do not know where she is at, at this time however she will be in touch if they find her.
